thread.title: Canada to Accept 'Historically High' Number of Refugees Amid New US Restrictions
thread.title_full: Canada to Accept 'Historically High' Number of Refugees Amid New US Restrictions

title: Canada to Accept 'Historically High' Number of Refugees Amid New US Restrictions
text:
2 12 0 1 Canada will not change its plan on refugee intake in response to new US migration restrictions, Minister of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Ahmed Hussen said. © AFP 2016/ PHILIPPE HUGUEN UK Should Adopt Canadian System of Immigrants' Integration - Lawmakers MOSCOW (Sputnik) — The announcment comes as US President Trump signed On Friday an executive order that suspended entry to the United States for citizens of Iran, Iraq, Libya, Somalia, Sudan, Syria and Yemen for 90 days. The decree also bans all refugees from entry for 120 days and bars all Syrian refugees from entering the United States indefinitely.
"Our immigration levels plan has an allocation that is historically high for refugees. We intend to maintain that plan," Hussen said, as quoted by the CBC broadcaster. 
Canada's immigration plan is set to accept 40,000 refugees in 2017, according to the the Canadian government.
